channel.title: Capitalizing everyone's name on ::players. HELP!

item.title: Capitalizing everyone's name on ::players. HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Vrunk Vrunk
item.description:
@Vrunk wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:6, topic:279872”]If their name is “test guy” It only makes it Test guy, how can I make it Test Guy? Also, it works for a little bit, then after a while, it will disconnect you if you try and type ::players. Here’s the error it gives me in the server window:

java.lang.NullPointerException at client.openPlayerMenu(client.java:8818) at client.customCommand(client.java:12319) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:22120) at client.packetProcess(client.java:17861) at client.packetSending(client.java:17814) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:154) at server.main(server.java:58)

Is it throwing an exception?[/quote]

No, it’s giving you a cookie.

Read full topic

java.lang.NullPointerException at client.openPlayerMenu(client.java:8818) at client.customCommand(client.java:12319) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:22120) at client.packetProcess(client.java:17861) at client.packetSending(client.java:17814) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:154) at server.main(server.java:58)

item.title: Capitalizing everyone's name on ::players. HELP!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

public void openPlayerMenu() {
    clearQuestInterface();
    int i = 0;
    sendQuest("@dre@          ~Online UniversalScape Players~", 8144);
    for(Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
        if(p != null) {
            sendQuest(p.modness + "@red@ " + Character.toUpperCase(p.playerName.charAt(0))
                    + p.playerName.substring(1).toLowerCase() + " @whi@- Combat: " + p.combat + "  ", 8147 + i++);
        }
    }
    sendQuestSomething(8143);
    showInterface(8134);
    flushOutStream();
}

Sorry about that.

Read full topic

[code]client.java:8818: char cannot be dereferenced
sendQuest(p.modness + "@red@ " + p.playerName.charAt(0).toUpperCase(
) + p.playerName.substring(1) + " @whi@- Combat: " + p.combat + " ", 8147 + i);

Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

I’ve tried messing around with the code to fix it, but I can’t, and it’s also 2:16 AM here and I’m tired

item.title: Capitalizing everyone's name on ::players. HELP!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:2, topic:279872”]try this

public void playerMenu() { clearQuestInterface(); closeListener(); for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; i++) { if(server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { { sendQuest("@dre@ ~Online UniversalScape Players~", 8144); //Title sendQuest(server.playerHandler.players[i].modness+"@red@ "+server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName+" @whi@- Combat: "+server.playerHandler.players[i].combat+" ", 8147+i); } } } sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }[/quote]
OMG HAHA SO FUNNY

Try this.

public void openPlayerMenu() {
    clearQuestInterface();
    int i = 0;
    for(Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
        if(p != null) {
            sendQuest("@dre@          ~Online UniversalScape Players~", 8144);  //Title
            sendQuest(p.modness + "@red@ " + p.playerName.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + p.playerName.substring(1) + " @whi@- Combat: " + p.combat + "  ", 8147 + i);
            i++;
        }
    }
    sendQuestSomething(8143);
    showInterface(8134);
    flushOutStream();
}

Note that I’ve changed some of the code to follow conventions (which also included changing the name of the method if that isn’t a problem).

Read full topic

item.title: Capitalizing everyone's name on ::players. HELP!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I know this has been done before, and it seems like it would be easy. I want to make it so instead of the username “test” on the ::players list, it displays “Test” and instead of “test man” it would display “Test Man”.

Here is my playerMenu method:

public void playerMenu() { clearQuestInterface(); for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; i++) { if(server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { { sendQuest("@dre@ ~Online UniversalScape Players~", 8144); //Title sendQuest(server.playerHandler.players[i].modness+"@red@ "+server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName+" @whi@- Combat: "+server.playerHandler.players[i].combat+" ", 8147+i); } } } sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }

Where you see sendQuest(server.playerHandler.players[i].modness+"@red@ "+server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName+" @whi@- Combat: "+server.playerHandler.players[i].combat+" ", 8147+i); All that is is a code I added to make it say Owner next to the owner’s name and Mod next to the Mod’s name etc. and it also displays their combat level. But back on topic, how would I do this?

ALSO: When a player sometimes logs out, it’ll leave a null behind, and will show random gaps between the player’s names on the online players list. I think it’s because it doesn’t kill and destruct the client and connection all the way. Am I right here? How do I fix this?

Read full topic
